node.title: Under the cover of the COVID-19 pandemic, another killer has risen
node.description: The brutal murder of Hannah Clarke and her children sent shock waves across the nation, butÂ it was short-lived, snatched away by what was perceived as a greater threat to come, writes Matt Wordsworth.
node.content:
["The ruthless murder of Hannah Clarke and her three children is one of those events that will forever haunt the mind \u2014 an act of such malevolence and barbarity that the mere mention of Hannah's name catapults you back to that day in February 2020.", "It was that day that\u00a0her estranged partner ambushed her car on the morning school run, doused its helpless occupants with fuel and let them burn.", "At last week's white ribbon day breakfast, a man who runs court-ordered programs for domestic violence offenders told me the shock waves that were sent through the community focused attention on domestic violence like he had rarely seen before.", "But\u00a0it was short-lived, snatched away again by what was perceived as a greater threat to come.", "Scott Morrison declared a pandemic later that same month.", "Queensland's Chief Health Officer warned one in four people would be infected.", "The body known as National Cabinet would be convened so that federal, state and territory governments could coordinate their responses.", "Billions of dollars flowed into testing, tracing and welfare support.", "It was a historic coming together that has seen just seven people die in Queensland from COVID-19.", "", "
Some of the many faces of alleged victims of domestic violence in Queensland.(ABC News: Lewi Hirvela)
", "You will know some of their names: Alexis Parkes; Hannah Clarke; Rebecca Walker; Doreen Langham; Robyn Beever; Kelly Wilkinson; Lourdi Ramadan; Angela Godwin; and just this week, Mary Benedito.", "Domestic violence has quite simply flourished under the cover of the pandemic.", "
A\u00a0flourishing pandemic of a different kind
", "Police statistics show that in the first 10 months of 2021, there have already been more breaches of Domestic Violence Orders (DVO) recorded than in the entire year of 2020, which itself was a record year.", "Since breaching a DVO became a crime there had not been a month with more than 3,000 offences until December, 2019.", "This year, there hasn't been a month under 3,000.", "Stalking\u00a0has also increased dramatically.", "Again, an annual record just 10 months into the year and the first time more than 100 offences have been reported in a month (July 2021).", "The sheer number of calls for help over domestic and family violence was acknowledged by the Premier in her speech at the White Ribbon Day breakfast.", "\"In 2020-21, police attended nearly 120,000 domestic and family violence matters, a 13 per cent increase from the previous year,\" she said.", "Despite the gloomy report card, Annastacia Palaszczuk was speaking in front of a record crowd, a sign that people \u2014 particularly men \u2014 are listening.", "And that is important. It is men who are far more often the perpetrator, but they are also the ones who can make the biggest difference.", "", "
Margaret McMurdo is set to hand\u00a0down her report\u00a0into legislation relating to coercive control today.(ABC News:\u00a0Stephen Cavenagh)
", "
Anti-sexist, male-led messaging\u00a0
", "It is a source of irony for Margaret McMurdo, who is leading the state government's Women's Safety and Justice Taskforce, that research shows male leaders articulate anti-sexism messages more effectively to both men and women.", "\"A spin off from a patriarchal system is that men are particularly effective change agents,\" Ms McMurdo said.", "\"And male leaders who call out sexist behaviour are more favourably regarded because of it. For all you good men change-agents, it's a win-win!\"", "The former president of the Court of Appeal has now handed her report into how to legislate against coercive control to the government and we will see it shortly.", "The new legislation, when it passes parliament, will be the latest weapon in the battle against domestic and family violence and its use will be closely monitored by campaigners, the media and the public.", "But there is one goal for these laws, and all the others that attempt to curb domestic and family violence \u2014 that there is never another case like Hannah Clarke's or the 374 others who have been murdered in Queensland in the past 15 years by someone they loved."]
